results.title: Power and the land
results.creator_credit: Joris Ivens, United States. Dept. of Agriculture and United States. Film Service
results.brief_description: Sensitive portrayal of American ideals and lifestyles, made to explain and promote the Department of Agriculture’s program of rural electrification. Filmed on the farm of Bill and Hazel Parkinson in St. Clairsville, Ohio, capturing the hardship of a nonelectrified farm and the progress and profit brought by electricity. The film is critical of the reluctance by public utility companies to install power to rural areas. A significant documentary that elevates the status of farmers and the value of their work. Cinematography, Floyd Crosby and Arthur Ornitz. Script, Edwin Locke. Editing, Helen van Dongen. Commentary by Stephen Vincent Benet. Music, Douglas Moore.

results.title: The Clown
results.creator_credit: Richard Balducci, Arthur Cohn and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Without Words”.
A shaggy dog, Clown, lives in Paris with a street urchin: the two are inseparable. One day Clown runs off while the boy plays with friends. Using a painting of Clown, the boy desperately tries to find his dog. He has nearly given up when he at last sees clown and rushes to embrace it. Joy turns to despair as the boy realises the dog has attached itself to a blind man. The boy walks away.

results.title: The Conductor. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A look at the art and technique of the conductor. In part two, conductor Verdon Williams discusses the tasks that a conductor must do before each performance - choosing the number and type of instruments needed; studying the melody and style of the music. Shows him rehearsing an orchestra and a choir.

results.title: To everything there is a season
results.creator_credit: Brian Bosisto, Bosisto Productions and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A general interest film exposing one of South Australia’s wildlife sanctuaries located at the Coorong. It instructively illustrates the interaction between the birds and the landscape against a backdrop of seasonal change. Of particular interest to students of the life sciences, conservationists and bird-watching societies. Narrated by John and Judith Dick.

results.title: Time to share
results.brief_description: Shows how voluntary workers undertake community work. Shows community aides working with underprivileged children, the sick, the elderly, migrants and unemployed teenagers. The community aides explain why they became voluntary community workers and outline the personal satisfaction they receive by giving their time to those who need assistance.

results.title: Runner
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In an age when most North American boys have their eyes on a car, there are a few who choose the older ideal of fleetness of foot. Such a one is Bruce Kidd, Toronto long-distance runner, winner of national and international honors. Oblivious of the clapping crowds and the flash of cameras, he knows full well that in the long run it is the cold stopwatch that tells the truth. Commentary written by W. H. Auden.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Owen, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Two thousand million years later
results.creator_credit: Ian Barry, David Waddington and S S Waddington Productions
results.brief_description: Outlines a holiday visit by a 12-year-old boy to his grandfather at Broken Hill. The grandfather, a retired miner, shows him the scope and method of underground mining carried out at Broken Hill. The holiday moves to the Western Australian operation of Hamersley Iron and later the northern Queensland operation of Mary Kathleen Uranium. We meet many people from these operations and see how they relax and enjoy themselves.

results.title: Araby
results.creator_credit: Zbigniew Raplewski and Documentary Film Studio in Warsaw
results.brief_description: Arabs thoroughbred horses on a Polish stud farm: from the slow opening of horses stirring against a dawn sky, the movement of the horses speeds up in the bright sun and heat of the day followed by a quiet interlude by a river. Film ends with a peaceful shot of horses being led back to the farm. Interesting use of natural sound.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Zbigniew Raplewski and Documentary Film Studio in Warsaw

results.title: Young Hands
results.creator_credit: W.H. Shepard, John Martin-Jones and John Appleton
results.brief_description:
Essentially an adverisement for the Juniour Farmer’s Organisation, focusing on how members and the community benefit from it. Stars ‘Hal’, a young man who must continue to run his family’s farm while his father is ill.

Follows Hal and other junior farmers members as they complete various ‘projects’ such as raising lambs, preserving fruit and growing crops. Strong social element within the organisation is exemplified by a social dance that is used to bookend Hal’s story.

Very earnest piece. Amusing end scene.

results.title: This is your museum speaking
results.creator_credit: Lynn Smith, David Verrall and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This short animated film tells the story of a night watchman who, with his dog, Fang, discovers that museums are not morgues, that they are very much a part of the community. With humor, the film shows how our present is connected to the past.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynn Smith, David Verrall and ONF | NFB
